values.description:
There was a dsl error after merging pull request #250

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_core/145/
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_handsim/132/

~~~
Processing DSL script handsim.dsl
ERROR: (handsim.dsl, line 337) No signature of method: javaposse.jobdsl.dsl.helpers.common.DownstreamTriggerParameterContext.predefinedProp() is applicable for argument types: (java.lang.String, java.lang.Boolean) values: [S3_UPLOAD_CANONICAL_PATH, false]
Possible solutions: predefinedProp(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), predefinedProps(java.util.Map), getPredefinedProps()
~~~
values.title: Use string instead of bool for predefinedProp

values.description:
I wanted to test building the homebrew bottles after pull request #250 was merged, and I found that some recent changes to upstream homebrew require us to make some changes (ie. broke things).

The simplest one is that the `HOMEBREW_DEVELOPER` environment variables must be set in order to use `brew test-bot` ([brew pr 298](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/298)), fixed in 67854f0.

A slightly more complicated change is that bottle metadata is now stored in a `.json` file instead of `.rb` ([brew pr 166](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/166)). This requires changing the `*.rb` to `*.json` in the dsl and changing how we identify the new hash (now using `brew ruby` instead of `grep | sed`).

I tested all these changes with the [sdformat 4.1.0 PR](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/100):

* [bottle builder](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/28/) successful
* [pr bottle hash updater](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/40/) made a successful commit, but failed when trying to create a new pull request, even though one was already open

In 24f8387, we started checking the `PULL_REQUEST_URL` variable in the `_homebrew_github_commit.bash` script to see if a new PR should be created, but that variable stopped getting propagated to the PR hash updater at some point. So I've restored that variable in the dsl for the pr bottle hash updater job in 482cd6d.

I tested the changes end-to-end on the [gazebo7 7.1.0 PR](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/93), and it all worked!

* [bottle builder](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/29/)
* [pr bottle hash updater](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/41/)
values.title: Fix bottle building

summary.raw:
I wanted to test building the homebrew bottles after pull request #250 was merged, and I found that some recent changes to upstream homebrew require us to make some changes (ie. broke things).

The simplest one is that the `HOMEBREW_DEVELOPER` environment variables must be set in order to use `brew test-bot` ([brew pr 298](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/298)), fixed in 67854f0.

A slightly more complicated change is that bottle metadata is now stored in a `.json` file instead of `.rb` ([brew pr 166](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/166)). This requires changing the `*.rb` to `*.json` in the dsl and changing how we identify the new hash (now using `brew ruby` instead of `grep | sed`).

I tested all these changes with the [sdformat 4.1.0 PR](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/100):

* [bottle builder](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/28/) successful
* [pr bottle hash updater](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/40/) made a successful commit, but failed when trying to create a new pull request, even though one was already open

In 24f8387, we started checking the `PULL_REQUEST_URL` variable in the `_homebrew_github_commit.bash` script to see if a new PR should be created, but that variable stopped getting propagated to the PR hash updater at some point. So I've restored that variable in the dsl for the pr bottle hash updater job in 482cd6d.

I tested the changes end-to-end on the [gazebo7 7.1.0 PR](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/93), and it all worked!

* [bottle builder](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/29/)
* [pr bottle hash updater](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/41/)
summary.html:
I wanted to test building the homebrew bottles after pull request #250 was merged, and I found that some recent changes to upstream homebrew require us to make some changes (ie. broke things).

The simplest one is that the HOMEBREW_DEVELOPER environment variables must be set in order to use brew test-bot (brew pr 298), fixed in 67854f0.

A slightly more complicated change is that bottle metadata is now stored in a .json file instead of .rb (brew pr 166). This requires changing the *.rb to *.json in the dsl and changing how we identify the new hash (now using brew ruby instead of grep | sed).

I tested all these changes with the sdformat 4.1.0 PR:

  • bottle builder successful
  • pr bottle hash updater made a successful commit, but failed when trying to create a new pull request, even though one was already open

In 24f8387, we started checking the PULL_REQUEST_URL variable in the _homebrew_github_commit.bash script to see if a new PR should be created, but that variable stopped getting propagated to the PR hash updater at some point. So I've restored that variable in the dsl for the pr bottle hash updater job in 482cd6d.

I tested the changes end-to-end on the gazebo7 7.1.0 PR, and it all worked!

  • bottle builder
  • pr bottle hash updater

values.description:
Refactor and implement the option to send several different compiling jobs into the same orchestration pipeline.

All them are running in parallel and run as a block together with the pre/post set build status jobs. The final jenkins result for the pipeline job is set to the worse result of the testing jobs.

With the inclusion of the parallel block we lost the ability to define stages inside the parallel block, so no more different stages for set status/building. Although the current visualisation is far from perfect, I think that it will improve with jenkins2 and upcoming versions.

This PR integrates the gazebo-nvidia and gazebo-no-gpu jobs to serve as example:

  * [Testing run #4 is complete](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any_test_multi2/). Only one stage.
  * [Testing run #5 is running](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any_test_multi2/) with two stages (current pull request code).
values.title: Integrate several jobs in orchestration

summary.raw:
Refactor and implement the option to send several different compiling jobs into the same orchestration pipeline.

All them are running in parallel and run as a block together with the pre/post set build status jobs. The final jenkins result for the pipeline job is set to the worse result of the testing jobs.

With the inclusion of the parallel block we lost the ability to define stages inside the parallel block, so no more different stages for set status/building. Although the current visualisation is far from perfect, I think that it will improve with jenkins2 and upcoming versions.

This PR integrates the gazebo-nvidia and gazebo-no-gpu jobs to serve as example:

  * [Testing run #4 is complete](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any_test_multi2/). Only one stage.
  * [Testing run #5 is running](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any_test_multi2/) with two stages (current pull request code).
summary.html:
Refactor and implement the option to send several different compiling jobs into the same orchestration pipeline.

All them are running in parallel and run as a block together with the pre/post set build status jobs. The final jenkins result for the pipeline job is set to the worse result of the testing jobs.

With the inclusion of the parallel block we lost the ability to define stages inside the parallel block, so no more different stages for set status/building. Although the current visualisation is far from perfect, I think that it will improve with jenkins2 and upcoming versions.

This PR integrates the gazebo-nvidia and gazebo-no-gpu jobs to serve as example:

  • Testing run #4 is complete. Only one stage.
  • Testing run #5 is running with two stages (current pull request code).

values.description:
The bottle hash updater failed (though it was marked successful) when trying to identify the formula path in `_homebrew_github_setup.bash` when a new formula was added in the pull request ([failing job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/47/)).

This PR will switch to the `PULL_REQUEST_BRANCH` if it is specified so that `check if the formula exists` can find new formulae added in pull requests. The [job was successful with this branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/49/).
values.title: checkout PULL_REQUEST_BRANCH if it is set in case a new formula is being added

summary.raw:
The bottle hash updater failed (though it was marked successful) when trying to identify the formula path in `_homebrew_github_setup.bash` when a new formula was added in the pull request ([failing job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/47/)).

This PR will switch to the `PULL_REQUEST_BRANCH` if it is specified so that `check if the formula exists` can find new formulae added in pull requests. The [job was successful with this branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/49/).
summary.html:
The bottle hash updater failed (though it was marked successful) when trying to identify the formula path in _homebrew_github_setup.bash when a new formula was added in the pull request (failing job).

This PR will switch to the PULL_REQUEST_BRANCH if it is specified so that check if the formula exists can find new formulae added in pull requests. The job was successful with this branch.

values.description:
The [Homebrew/linuxbrew repository](https://github.com/Homebrew/linuxbrew/blob/master/README.md) has been deprecated and split into [Linuxbrew/brew](https://github.com/Linuxbrew/brew) and [Linuxbrew/homebrew-core](https://github.com/Linuxbrew/homebrew-core).

This PR switches to cloning the new `Linuxbrew/brew` instead of the old version.
values.title: clone linuxbrew from Linuxbrew/brew instead of legacy Homebrew/linuxbrew location

This PR switches to cloning the new `Linuxbrew/brew` instead of the old version.
summary.html:
The Homebrew/linuxbrew repository has been deprecated and split into Linuxbrew/brew and Linuxbrew/homebrew-core.

This PR switches to cloning the new Linuxbrew/brew instead of the old version.

values.description:
I've updated our jenkins slave to cmake 3.5. There are some changes in the FindProtobuf.cmake that requires our custom build to be modified. I've uploaded the modified version and leave the previous in place to keep current documentation working.

Here is how it affects to ign-transport:

 * [Fail build with default release-tools](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-default-windows7-amd64/55)
 * [Working build with this branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-default-windows7-amd64/56)
values.title: Use new version of protobuf on Windows with cmake 3.5 fixes

values.description:
Do not fail the `_bitbucket_set_status` job if the osrf user don't have perms to publish bitbucket status, which usually happen on external forks.

Tested:

 * An [ok with perms](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status/591/)
 * An [unstable without perms](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status/589/)
values.title: Avoid fail the _bitbucket_set_status job on external repo

summary.raw:
Do not fail the `_bitbucket_set_status` job if the osrf user don't have perms to publish bitbucket status, which usually happen on external forks.

Tested:

 * An [ok with perms](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status/591/)
 * An [unstable without perms](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status/589/)
summary.html:
Do not fail the _bitbucket_set_status job if the osrf user don't have perms to publish bitbucket status, which usually happen on external forks.

  • An ok with perms
  • An unstable without perms

values.description:
This PR implements the connection between gazebo_ros_pkgs repository and jenkins to implement testing in the pull request sent in the github repository. Details:

 * DSL will create a `ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any-${ubuntu_distro}-amd64` able to run the different ROS distributions. It also uses the standard gazebo package from the different ROS distributions.
 * DSL will also create a `ros_gazebo7_pkgs-ci-pr_any-${ubuntu_distro}-amd64` that will run testing using the gazebo7 package. Other jobs for different gazebo packages can be easily added to this CI in the gazebo_ros_pkgs.dsl.
 * Both jobs are triggered automatically from github on every pull request or under a comment `run test please`

I've modified the jobs for testing to watch for my repo and use this branch. Testing PR:

 * https://github.com/j-rivero/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/6
values.title: Integrate gazebo_ros_pkgs github with jenkins

values.description:
The build farm implement the library (Build Failer Analyser) for identifying problems in jenkins build jobs and report the detailed information and direct links to errors in the jenkins mails. Hopefully this can speed up our time accessing to what's wrong when something fail.

An example of a mail using the new setup:

```
gnition_msgs-ci-default-wily-amd64 - Build # 14 - Failure:

Identified problems:
* Failed to install some packages: There was a problem installing some packages, if the problem is persistent it could be a bug in the testing infrastructure.
  * Indication 1:
    <http://build.osrfoundation.org//job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-wily-amd64/14/consoleFull#-1850710222916f16c6-32f6-4563-8cf6-e0491cbe9323>


Full log: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-wily-amd64/14//14/consoleFull
Retry   : http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-wily-amd64/14//14/retry



Test summary:
-------------
 * Total of  tests :  failed and

Data log:
No tests ran.
```
values.title: Use build failer analyser for more descriptive error mails

values.description:
Changes and features:

* Remove old pbuilder scripts
* DSL to generate testing jobs (-ci_pr- and install) for the different drcsim flavours
* dcsim-compilation (catkin) and drcsim-install docker scripts

* [drcsim5 install pkg](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim5-install-pkg-trusty-amd64/15/)
* [drcim5 compilation](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim5-ci-default-trusty-amd64/12/console). Currently failing, no tests?
* [ros_gazebo_pkgs](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_jade-trusty-amd64/17/)

values.description:
http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-pkg_builder-master-debian_sid-amd64/39/consoleFull displays the error:

```
perl: warning: Setting locale failed.
perl: warning: Please check that your locale settings:
	LANGUAGE = "en_GB",
	LC_ALL = "en_GB.utf8",
	LANG = "en_GB.utf8"
    are supported and installed on your system.
perl: warning: Falling back to the standard locale ("C").
```

This branch fixes the problem: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-pkg_builder-master-debian_sid-amd64/43/

values.description:
After merging the [gazebo multi any job](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/215/gazebo-multi-any-job/diff) most of the compilation jobs were broken since the build.sh script was generated without variable expansion.

values.title: Extra QA for debian packages

values.description:
Project specific changes:

 * Installation test job
 * Debian package generator

Other general changes:

 * Refactor the `OSRFLinuxBuildPkg` to be able to reuse values for software that does not use the -release repositories.
 * Debbuild now respects the `NIGHTLY_MODE` variable if it was set previously and not only rely on `UPLOAD_TO_REPO=nightly`. This make possible the inclussion of nightly packages in the stable repository if it is explicitly requested.
 * Support for nightlies generated from GIT, not only mercurial.
 * Support to use the generic "repo" directory for sources (`USE_REPO_DIRECTORY_FOR_NIGHTLY`), no need to always use `PACKAGE_NAME`.
values.title: GEAR implementation

summary.raw:
Project specific changes:

 * Installation test job
 * Debian package generator

Other general changes:

 * Refactor the `OSRFLinuxBuildPkg` to be able to reuse values for software that does not use the -release repositories.
 * Debbuild now respects the `NIGHTLY_MODE` variable if it was set previously and not only rely on `UPLOAD_TO_REPO=nightly`. This make possible the inclussion of nightly packages in the stable repository if it is explicitly requested.
 * Support for nightlies generated from GIT, not only mercurial.
 * Support to use the generic "repo" directory for sources (`USE_REPO_DIRECTORY_FOR_NIGHTLY`), no need to always use `PACKAGE_NAME`.
summary.html:
Project specific changes:

  • Installation test job
  • Debian package generator

Other general changes:

  • Refactor the OSRFLinuxBuildPkg to be able to reuse values for software that does not use the -release repositories.
  • Debbuild now respects the NIGHTLY_MODE variable if it was set previously and not only rely on UPLOAD_TO_REPO=nightly. This make possible the inclussion of nightly packages in the stable repository if it is explicitly requested.
  • Support for nightlies generated from GIT, not only mercurial.
  • Support to use the generic "repo" directory for sources (USE_REPO_DIRECTORY_FOR_NIGHTLY), no need to always use PACKAGE_NAME.

values.description: @\_jrivero\_  - updated gazebo branch to merge from default so resulted in some [missing dependencies](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo_ardupilot-ci-default-xenial-amd64/20/console). I traced the dependency check in jenkins scripts to this line. Adding it seems to have [worked](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo_ardupilot-ci-default-xenial-amd64/21/console)

I traced the dependency check in jenkins scripts to this line. Adding it seems to have [worked](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo_ardupilot-ci-default-xenial-amd64/21/console)

values.description:
nightly debbuilds are broken, possibly due to pull request #286 (sorry I didn't get a chance to review that):

* sdformat4 [build 1355](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat4-debbuilder/1355/) through [build 1359](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat4-debbuilder/1359/)
* gazebo8 [build 462](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/gazebo8-debbuilder/462/) through [build 464](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/gazebo8-debbuilder/464)

error:

~~~
# BEGIN SECTION: import the debian metadata
+ REAL_PACKAGE_NAME=gazebo
build.sh: line 36: unexpected argument `]]' to conditional unary operator
~~~
values.title: add quoting around variable in [[ ]] brackets to fix debbuild

values.description:
**Changes:**

* Fix the compilation of all gazebo dependencies

* Fix the ignition transport windows compilation

* Update dependencies: ogre 1.8 to 1.9 and zmq 3.2.4 to 4.0.4

* Support for disabling test in the generic job

* New installation of qwt dependency 

**Tested:**

* [Gazebo log](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/889/console) with configuration complete except for `libqwt-dev`
* [ignition transport](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/307/console) using this branch.

Note: this change requireds to be in sync with the [ignition-transport PR that updates to zmq 4.0.4](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/171/update-windows-to-use-zeromq-404/diff)
values.title: Fix Windows compilation of gazebo dependencies

* [ignition transport](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/307/console) using this branch.

Note: this change requireds to be in sync with the [ignition-transport PR that updates to zmq 4.0.4](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/171/update-windows-to-use-zeromq-404/diff)

  • ignition transport using this branch.

Note: this change requireds to be in sync with the ignition-transport PR that updates to zmq 4.0.4

values.description:
Currently there are a few problems with our homebrew scripts.

* the `.git` folder is now installed to `/usr/local/Homebrew/.git` instead of `/usr/local/.git`
* building bottles with `test-bot` fails if there are other packages installed, so mercurial is not installed from `_homebrew_cleanup` anymore.

Example failures:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/163/console
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/653/console

Fixed with this branch:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_math-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/40/
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/72/
values.title: Move brew cleanup into separate script

summary.raw:
Currently there are a few problems with our homebrew scripts.

* the `.git` folder is now installed to `/usr/local/Homebrew/.git` instead of `/usr/local/.git`
* building bottles with `test-bot` fails if there are other packages installed, so mercurial is not installed from `_homebrew_cleanup` anymore.

Example failures:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/163/console

summary.html:
Currently there are a few problems with our homebrew scripts.

  • the .git folder is now installed to /usr/local/Homebrew/.git instead of /usr/local/.git
  • building bottles with test-bot fails if there are other packages installed, so mercurial is not installed from _homebrew_cleanup anymore.

Example failures:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/163/console
  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/653/console

Fixed with this branch:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_math-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/40/
  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/72/

values.description:
Two quick fixes/workarounds:

 * Solve the git modifications done in Homebrew/Library [as recommended by the own brew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/657/console)
 * brew tap performs so checks at the beggining and if it found a problem it will be displayed in the screen [making the parsing of taps invalid](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/128/console).
values.title: Fixes to keep brew doctor happy

summary.raw:
Two quick fixes/workarounds:

 * Solve the git modifications done in Homebrew/Library [as recommended by the own brew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/657/console)
 * brew tap performs so checks at the beggining and if it found a problem it will be displayed in the screen [making the parsing of taps invalid](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/128/console).
summary.html:
Two quick fixes/workarounds:

  • Solve the git modifications done in Homebrew/Library as recommended by the own brew
  • brew tap performs so checks at the beggining and if it found a problem it will be displayed in the screen making the parsing of taps invalid.

values.description:
* add brew up in homebrew cleanup script, this will prevent a bunch of extra console spam when running `brew tap`

* remove curl workaround, since the upstream pkg-config problem has been fixed (replaces pull request #297)

* use `brew --prefix instead` of HOMEBREW_PREFIX

* use BREW_BINARY instead of just brew

[bottle build with this branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/75/)

* use BREW_BINARY instead of just brew
